<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	B. Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In response to the limited availability of financing for Argentine companies, we closely monitor our liquidity levels in order to ensure compliance with our financial obligations and to achieve our objectives. Our cash flows from operations have been affected in recent years due to the lack of adjustment to our natural gas transportation tariffs to cover increases in our operating costs. Along these lines, and as a guiding principle, financial solvency is our main objective.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	To preserve cash surpluses, we invest in low risk and highly liquid financial assets offered by high quality financial institutions that are located in Argentina and the United States of America. Our policy is designed to diversify credit risk. We also prioritize investing our cash surpluses in U.S. dollar denominated financial assets as our debt is almost 100% U.S. dollar denominated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In the short term, the most significant factors generally affecting our cash flow from operating activities are: (i)&nbsp;fluctuations in international prices for LPG products, (ii) fluctuations in production levels and demand for our products and services, (iii)&nbsp;changes in regulations, such as taxes, taxes on exports, tariff for our regulated business segment and price controls, and (iv)&nbsp;fluctuations in exchange rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	41
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage81"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Within the framework of the 2008 Transitional Agreement, in the fiscal years 2015 and 2014, we received two tariff increases. These increases were not enough to offset the significant increases in costs recorded over the last years, in spite of our continuous efforts to reduce them. Although this situation has resulted in an annual operating loss in the last two years, the tariff increases were important to achieve the aim of partially improving the economic situation of this business segment until we arrive at an understanding with the Government with respect to the Integral Renegotiation Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Both tariff increases were authorized by Resolutions No. I-2852/14 and No. I-3347/15 issued by ENARGAS and include the following increases, respectively:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:52.4PX; WIDTH:76.4PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:76.4PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A stepped increase of 8% as from April 1, 2014, 14% accumulated since June 1, 2014 and 20% accumulated since August 1, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:52.4PX; WIDTH:76.4PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:76.4PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As from May 1, 2015, a transitional increase of 44.3% in the price of the natural gas transportation service and 73.2% in the CAU.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	In March 2016, the ENARGAS granted us a transitional increase of 200.1% in natural gas transportation tariffs and the CAU, effective April 1, 2016. The purpose of the increase is to cover costs and investments associated with the regular provision of the public service of natural gas transportation until the Integral Renegotiation Agreements is finalized.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Pursuant to Resolution No. 3724, we must also execute the Investment Plan, which will amount to Ps. 794.3 million. The Investment Plan must be concluded by March 2017. We expect to fund the capital expenditures under the Investment Plan with funds generated by our operations. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Starting in the fourth quarter of 2014, the Liquids Production and Commercialization business segment, as it is mentioned in &#147;Item 5&#151;A. Operating results &#151;Liquids Production and Commercialization.&#148;, began to be affected by the sharp decline in the reference international prices of the Liquids which kept at very low levels during 2015 and the first quarter of 2016. In 2015, we also continued participating in the Stabilization Agreement Program, through which butane is commercialized at subsidized sales prices, despite significantly higher production costs, thus generating a loss of approximately of Ps. 100 million in 2015. For further information see &#147;Item 4&#151;A. Our Information&#151;Liquids Production and Commercialization.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The aspects described above have changed our operating cash flow, especially the operating cash flow corresponding to the Liquids business segment that in prior years had mitigated the natural gas transportation segment difficulties and the profitability decrease as a consequence of the sustained cost increase not reflected in the tariff increase. Nonetheless, during 2015, our operating cash generation has been sufficient to meet our operating costs and capital expenditures.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In previous years, increased prices and volumes in our Liquids production and commercialization segment have compensated for the decrease in the operating income of our Natural Gas Transportation business segment, which has been negatively affected by the continuous increase in its operational cost and the lack of tariff adjustment since 1999.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	On December 17, 2015, the new administration of the Executive Branch issued certain measures that involved the opening of foreign exchange controls in force over the last four years. As a result, the official exchange rate published by Banco de la Naci&#243;n Argentina increased from Ps. 9.83 per U.S. dollar on December 16, 2015 to Ps. 13.95 per U.S. dollar on December 18, 2015. The new regulation modifies the existing regimes related to, among others, (i) the purchase of external assets by Argentine residents for investment purposes; (ii) arbitration and foreign currency swap; (iii) financial indebtedness (i.e., repatriation obligation, mandatory deposit, minimum waiting period; prepayment); and (iv) imports of goods and services. For additional information see &#147;Item 10 &#150; Additional information &#150; D. Exchange controls.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	A potential new devaluation of the peso, additional capital expenditures required by the Government or lower liquids prices could harm our cash-generating ability and materially adversely affect our liquidity and our ability to service our debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	42
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>

<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The decline in international reference prices could be regarded as circumstantial, but has structural effects that could adversely affect the operating margins of our Liquids Production and Commercialization business segment, which up to this year had allowed us to balance our cash flows, offsetting the negative effect of the lack of natural gas transportation tariffs adjustment. We cannot predict the level and the time when the decline in oil prices will stop. Thus, these negative factors further emphasize the need to continue to strengthen all our efforts aimed at obtaining the expected adjustment of our tariffs in the natural gas transportation segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Our primary sources and uses of cash during the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 are shown in the table below:

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Cash Flows Provided by Operating Activities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows provided by operating activities&nbsp;were Ps. 489.3 million and Ps. 1,019.0 million in 2015 and 2014, respectively. The decrease of Ps. 529.7 million in 2015 against 2014 was mainly due to an increase in the payments for accounts payable for the acquisition of goods and services and the decrease in the collection of trade receivables, which were collected in January 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows from operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2014 increased by Ps. 148.0 million compared to 2013, principally due to the increase in the operating income of Ps. 226.0 million, partially offset by higher financial interest paid of Ps. 36.6 million and payments made with respect to the financial derivate instruments of Ps. 59.7 million. The increase in the operating income is mainly attributable to higher cash flow generated by the Liquids productions and commercialization segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Cash Flows Used in Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows used for investing activities increased by Ps. 56.1 million in 2015 compared with 2014. This increase is mainly due to higher capital expenditures of Ps. 51.4 million due to higher costs incurred for carrying out repair and maintenance of pipeline system operated by us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows used for investing activities decreased by Ps. 290.2 million in 2014 compared with 2013. This decrease is mainly due to the increase in cash flows generated by the sale of financial assets, other than cash equivalents, of Ps. 405.4 million used to meet our financial obligations. This effect was offset by higher capital expenditures of Ps. 115.2 million due to higher costs incurred for carrying out repair and maintenance of the pipeline system operated by us and the works performed to build a new storage tank (see &#147;Item 4. Our Information &#150; A. Our History and Development &#150; Capital Expenditures.&#148;)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Cash Flows used in Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows used in financing activities decreased by Ps. 687.8 million in 2015 compared with 2014 mainly due to the payment of U.S. dollar 94.7 million in principal of our financial debt in May 2014. Meanwhile, in May 2015 we paid U.S. dollar 30.4 million in principal of our financial debt according to contractual terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	43
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Cash flows used in financing activities increased by Ps. 744.3 million in 2014 compared with 2013 mainly due to the payment of U.S. dollar 94.7 million of principal of our financial debt in May 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In addition, during our Board of Directors meeting of November 26, 2014, the Board of Directors approved the distribution of Ps. 260.5 million as a cash dividend (of which Ps. 36.8 million net of taxes were paid in January 2016). In 2015, we did not paid any cash dividend.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Description of Indebtedness
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In December 2004, we restructured for the first time substantially all of our debt obligations by means of an exchange offer for new notes (the &#147;
<B>
	Restructured Notes
</B>
	&#148;), which was accepted by creditors holding 99.76% of the principal amount of the debt that we sought to restructure. Taking into account the governing law of the unrestructured amount, in July 2012 our Board of Directors has deemed claims of creditors barred pursuant to the statute of limitations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Beginning in April 2007, we began a series of steps to refinance the Restructured Notes and the amended and restated loan agreements with Inter-American Development Bank (the
<B>
	&#147;Amended Loans&#148;
</B>
	). These steps included a tender offer and proxy solicitation with respect to all of the Restructured Notes (the
<B>
	&#147;Tender Offer&#148;
</B>
	), which was completed in May 2007 and accepted by 78.4% of the note holders; a new notes offering (described below); an optional prepayment of amounts outstanding under the Amended Loans; and the redemption of all of the Restructured Notes remaining after the completion of the Tender Offer. Concurrent with the Tender Offer, we commenced an offering of new notes in an aggregate principal amount of US$ 500 million (the
<B>
	&#147;2007 Notes&#148;
</B>
	) pursuant to our Medium Term Note Program (the
<B>
	&#147;2007 Program&#148;
</B>
	), which provides for the issuance of up to a maximum principal amount of US$ 650 million in notes. The interest rate for the 2007 Notes is fixed at 7.875%, and the maturity date is May 14, 2017. The principal amount will be amortized in four equal payments, which will mature on May 14, 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Between August 2008 and August 2010, we cancelled the 2007 Notes with a nominal value of US$ 125,976,000, which were purchased by us on market, at prices lower than their nominal value. These purchases and cancellations helped us to reduce our finance costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	In order to improve the maturity profile of our financial debt, in January 2014 we launched an offer for a voluntary exchange of the 2007 Notes (the
<B>
	&#147;Exchange Offer&#148;
</B>
	). The Exchange Offer settled on February 11, 2014. We accepted 67% of the 2007 Notes, US$ 250,741,000 aggregate principal amount and issued US$ 255,451,506 of new notes (the
<B>
	&#147;2014 Notes&#148;
</B>
	) pursuant to our Medium Term Note Program approved by the CNV on January 3, 2014 (the
<B>
	&#147;2014 Program&#148;
</B>
	). The 2014&nbsp;Notes bear interest at a fixed rate of 9.625% per annum, and the principal will be amortized in four equal payments, the first one amortized in May 2014 while the remaining payments will mature on May 14, 2018, 2019 and 2020.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	As of the date of this Annual Report, our total indebtedness under the 2007 Notes amounted to US$61,641,500 and thus, the amortization payments amount to US$ 30,820,750 payable in each of 2016 and 2017. Our total indebtedness under the 2014 Notes amounted to US$ 191,588,630 and thus, the amortization payments amount to US$ 63,862,876 payable in each of 2018, 2019 and 2020. See &#147;Item 10. Additional Information &#150; C. Material Contracts &#150;Debt Obligations.&#148; The first amortization payment was in May 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	We are subject to several restrictive covenants under both our 2014 Notes and our 2017 Notes that limit our ability to obtain additional financing, including limitations on our ability to incur additional indebtedness to create liens on our property, assets or revenues. In addition to the required principal amortization payment obligations, we are also subject to other restrictive covenants that affect our use of cash on hand, such as limitations on our ability to pay dividends to our shareholders and limitations on our ability to sell our assets. See &#147;Item 10. Additional Information&#151;C. Material Contracts&#151;Debt Obligations&#148; for a detailed discussion of the terms of our financial debt, including the interest rates and material covenants applicable to such indebtedness.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Beginning in 2013, we implemented actions aimed at minimizing the impact of the exchange rate variation on our financial indebtedness, including entering into currency forward agreements with major financial institutions for the purchase of U.S. dollars to cover exposure to the exchange rate risk derived
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	44
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
	from our financial indebtedness. In addition, we will invest in financial instruments which reflect the variation of the exchange rate. In light of the current financial crisis and the macroeconomic environment, our ability to finance our financial debt payments could be limited.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	During the years 2015 and 2014 a financial income / (expense) of Ps. 128.5 million and (Ps. 103.5 million) was recognized as a result of currency forward agreements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	On August 24, 2012, we signed a Ps. 20.0 million loan with Santander R&#237;o Bank (the &#147;
<B>
	Santander Loan
</B>
	&#148;), which bears interest at fixed rate of 15.01% per annum, payable monthly. The Santander Loan amortized principal in nine quarterly and equal installments of Ps. 2.2 million, beginning on August 26, 2013 and matured in August 2015. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	During 2013, we obtained two loans. The first, on November 22, 2013, was a financial loan of Ps. 20.0 million received from Banco Ita&#250; Argentina S.A. Payments of principal are due in 25 equal and consecutive monthly installments beginning in November 2014 and ending in November 2016. The loan bears an interest rate of 15.25%, and it must be repaid on a monthly basis after its execution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Also, on December 3, 2013, we obtained a loan from Banco Macro S.A. of Ps. 10.0 million. The loan bears an interest rate of 15.25%, to be repaid monthly. Payments of principal are due in equal and consecutive monthly installments beginning in July 2014 and ending in April 2017.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>

<SUP>
	(1)

	The corresponding works of 2016 will be financed by our clients through prepayment of the service to be provided.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The table above includes the capital works necessary to comply with the mandatory Investment Plan to be executed in the period April 2016 &#150; March 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	We currently expect that our capital investment requirements will be financed primarily by cash from operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Currency and Exchange Rates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Our primary market risk exposure is associated with changes in the foreign currency exchange rates because most of our debt obligations are denominated in U.S. dollars and more than Ps. 1,687.9 million
<B>
</B>
	of our annual revenues are peso-denominated. Contributing to this exposure are the measures taken by the Government since the repeal of the Convertibility Law and the pesification of our regulated tariffs described elsewhere in this Annual Report. This exposure is mitigated in part by our revenues from our Liquids Production and Commercialization segment, 83.8% of which are denominated in U.S. dollars. See &#147;Item 3&#151;Key Information Exchange Rates Information.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	We place our cash and current investments in high quality financial institutions in Argentina and the United States of America. Our policy is to limit exposure with any one institution. Our temporary
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	45
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage85"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
	investments primarily consist in money market mutual funds and fixed-term deposits. In addition, in order to reduce our exposure to currency exchange rates, during 2013 our Board of Directors approved a change in our investment policy allowing us to invest in funds and other instruments to compensate for the negative impact of the variation of the peso against the U.S. dollar on our net liability position, which is primarily in U.S. dollars. To that end, we have entered into forward purchase transactions. For further information see &#147;&#151;Derivative Financial Instruments&#148; below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Our financial debt obligations denominated in foreign currency as of December 31, 2015, amounted to US$ 254.7 million (Ps.&nbsp;3,321.0 million). As of December 31, 2015, we also had the equivalent of US$ 21.1 million (Ps.&nbsp;275.7 million) of trade and other payables denominated in U.S. dollars. Finally, US$ 89.1 million (Ps.&nbsp;1,152.6 million) of our assets are denominated in U.S. dollars. Therefore, our net liability position in U.S. dollars amounted to US$ 186.8 million as of December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	We estimate, based on the net liability financial position of our balance sheet as of December 31, 2015 that, other factors being constant, a 10% appreciation of the U.S. dollar against the Argentine Peso for the year ended December 31, 2015, would have decreased our income before tax for the year in approximately Ps. 244.4 million. A 10% depreciation of the U.S. dollar against the Argentine Peso would have an equal and opposite effect on the income statement. This sensitivity analysis provides only a limited view of the market risk sensitivity of certain of our financial instruments. The actual impact of market foreign exchange rate changes on our financial instruments may differ significantly from the impact shown in the sensitivity analysis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Derivative Financial Instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Our Board of Directors has approved the terms for acquiring derivative financial instruments in order to hedge risks associated with the fluctuation of interest and exchange rates of our debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	To mitigate foreign exchange risk, during 2015 and 2014 we entered into forward purchase transactions of U.S. dollars to cover the risk exposure associated with exchange rates derived from our U.S. dollar denominated financial position.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As of December 31, 2015, the net position is buying U.S. dollars amounting to US$ 52.5 million, at a weighted average exchange rate of Ps. 11.37 per $1, for settlement on May 2016. The fair value of outstanding derivative financial instruments as of December 31, 2015 amounted to a net asset position of Ps. 128.1 million. Such contracts are guaranteed by Ps. 29.9 million, which are disclosed under &#147;Other Receivables.&#148; During 2015, we recognized a gain of Ps. 128.5 million because of our currency forward purchase transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	We do not enter into derivative financial instrument agreements for speculative purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.267PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We do not believe that we are exposed to significant interest rate risk because the interest rates on our all of debt obligations are fixed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	C. Research and Development, Patents and Licenses, etc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Not applicable.

	(1)
</P>

	Refers to amortization and interest payments on the 2007 and 2014 Notes as described in &#147;Item 5. Operating and Financial Review of Prospects &#150; Description of indebtedness.&#148; and &#147;Item 10 &#150; Additional Information. C.Material Contracts&#148;, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:12PX; WIDTH:36PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(2)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:10.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:36PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-43.867PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The total amount of interest payments includes Ps. 866.9 million of estimated interest payments not accrued according to the 2007 and 2014 Notes as of December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:12PX; WIDTH:36PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(3)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:10.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:36PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-43.867PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Refers to agreements for the purchase of natural gas used in our liquids production and commercialization activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:12PX; WIDTH:36PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(4)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:10.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:36PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-43.867PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Refers to the estimated technical assistance service agreement to be paid to Petrobras Argentina Group pursuant to Section 2.5 of the Technical Assistance Service Agreement. For more information see, &#147;Item 4. Our Information&#151;B. Business Overview&#151; Gas Transportation&#151;Pipeline Operations&#151;Technical Assistance Service Agreement.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT">
	99.6
</FONT>
	% of the debt obligation amounts set forth in the table above are U.S. dollar-denominated and, therefore, principal and accrued interest included in the amounts presented have been converted to peso amounts using the selling exchange rate of US$1.00 = Ps. 13.04 as of December 31, 2015. Actual foreign currency debt payments may significantly differ from these estimates due to exchange rate fluctuations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:75.867PX; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	Item 6.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:16PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
<B>
	Directors, Senior Management and Employees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:168PX; WIDTH:192PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:192PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	Directors and Senior Management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.267PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	General
</I>
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
	Management of our business is vested in the Board of Directors. Our By-laws provide for a board of directors consisting of a minimum of nine directors and nine alternate directors and a maximum of 11 directors and 11 alternate directors. In the absence of one or more directors, alternate directors will attend meetings of the Board of Directors. Directors and alternate directors are elected at an ordinary meeting of shareholders and serve one- to three-year renewable terms, as decided by the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Under our By-laws and Argentine law, the Board of Directors is required to meet at least once every three months. A majority of the members of the Board of Directors constitutes a quorum, and resolutions must be adopted by a majority of the directors present. In the case of a tie, the Chairman or the person replacing him at a particular meeting is entitled to cast the deciding vote. Upon motion by the Chairman our Board of Directors&#146; meetings may be held by video or telephone conference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The current Board of Directors consists on nine directors and nine alternate directors, all of whom were elected by our shareholders at the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting held on April 20, 2016, for a one-year term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	47
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The Shareholders&#146; Agreement (as defined in &#147;Item 7. Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#151;A. Major Shareholders&#151;Shareholders&#146; Agreement&#148;) contains provisions governing the voting of our shares held by CIESA, the election of the members of our Board of Directors and certain other matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	As we mentioned above, in December 2008, as a consequence of the enactment of Law No. 26,425, the AFJPs transferred their share participation of our outstanding capital stock (which as of the date of issuance of this Annual Report represents 23.1% of our common stock) to the FGS managed by the ANSES. At our General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting held on April 20, 2016, the ANSES appointed Mauricio Edgardo Szmulewiez and Sergio Benito Patr&#243;n Costas as independent directors and Ignacio Gustavo Alvarez Pizzo and Lourdes Armada as independent alternate directors
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
	who presented their resignation during 2014. Pursuant to Decree No. 1,278/12, issued by the Executive Branch on July&nbsp;25, 2012, these representatives are to report directly to the MEF and are subject to a mandatory information-sharing regime, under which, among other obligations, they must immediately inform the MEF of the agenda for each board of directors meeting and provide related documentation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	On February 2015, the Executive Branch enacted Decree No. 196/2015, which complements the provisions of Decree 1278/2012, mainly extending indemnity and legal assistance coverage to directors and statutory committee members appointed by the Government in companies in which it has stock participation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The General Companies Law governs the way directors are appointed. Directors are appointed by the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting or by the Statutory Committee as the case may be, when authorized by the &#147;By-Laws&#148;. It is not mandatory to be a shareholder of the company to be eligible as director. Section 263 of the General Corporations Act mandates that up to one third of the members of the board can be appointed by the &#147;cumulative vote system.&#148; The vote of each shareholder who chooses to use the &#147;cumulative vote system&#148; shall be multiplied by the number of members to be appointed; the result may be partially or fully allocated to any of the candidates. All of the shareholders are entitled to choose the &#147;cumulative vote system&#148; in other words, not only ANSES has the right to appoint members to the Board of Directors through that system.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.267PX">
<B>
<I>
	Duties and Liabilities of Directors.
</I>
</B>
	Under Argentine law, directors have the obligation to perform their duties with the loyalty and diligence of a prudent business person. Directors are jointly and severally liable to us, shareholders and third parties for the improper performance of their duties, for violating the law, our By-laws or regulations, if any, and for any damage caused by fraud, abuse of authority or gross negligence. Under Argentine law, specific duties may be assigned to a director by our By-laws or regulations or by a resolution of a shareholders&#146; meeting. In such cases, a director&#146;s liability will be determined with reference to the performance of such duties, provided that certain recording requirements are met. Moreover, under Argentine law, directors are prohibited from engaging in activities in competition with us without express shareholder authorization. Certain transactions between us and directors are subject to ratification procedures established by Argentine law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	A director who participates in the adoption of a resolution or who advises on or recognizes such resolution, will be exempted from liability if he leaves written evidence of his objection and notifies the Statutory Committee before his liability is reported to the board of directors, Statutory Committee, a shareholders&#146; meeting, or competent authority or before judicial action is exercised. Shareholder approval of a director&#146;s performance terminates any liability of a director vis-&#224;-vis us, provided that shareholders representing at least 5% of our capital stock do not object and that such liability does not result from a violation of the law or our By-laws or regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Causes of action against directors may be initiated by us upon a majority vote of shareholders. If a cause of action has not been initiated within three months of a shareholders&#146; resolution approving its initiation, any shareholder may initiate the action on behalf of and for our account.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	At the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting held on March 6, 1996, our shareholders approved the acquisition of civil liability insurance coverage for directors, Syndics and officers. Such coverage is common practice among public companies who seek protection for such persons against shareholders&#146; and other parties&#146; claims.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	48
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-TOP:4PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Four of the members of our Board of Directors qualify as independent as defined in Section 301 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act and the CNV rules. Three of them are also members of our Audit Committee. The remaining members of the Board of Directors are not independent. Under the independence requirements, a director is not independent if any of the following apply:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	is also a member of the administrative body or dependent on shareholders who hold &#147;significant shareholding&#148; of the issuer, or any corporation in which those shareholders hold directly or indirectly &#147;significant shareholding,&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	is engaged or was engaged during the last three years to the issuer under a contract of employment,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	provides, or belongs to a professional corporation or association, which renders professional services to or receives any form of remuneration or fees (other than the corresponding remuneration for its position in the administration body) from the issuer, or those shareholders that have any direct or indirect &#147;significant shareholding&#148; in TGS or from corporations in which shareholders also have any direct or indirect &#147;significant shareholding,&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	directly or indirectly holds &#147;significant shareholding&#148; in the issuer or any corporation, which holds &#147;significant shareholding&#148; in the latter,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	directly or indirectly sells or provides goods or services to the issuer or its shareholders, who hold direct or indirect &#147;significant shareholding,&#148; for an amount substantially higher than the compensation received for their position as members of the administration body, or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	is a husband or wife, close relative up to fourth degree of kinship or second degree of relationship that, in case of being a member of the administration body, would not be independent as set forth in the CNV regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.267PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	In all cases, &#147;significant shareholding&#148; refers to those shareholders holding at least fifteen per cent (15%) of our common stock, or less in cases when they are entitled to appoint one or more directors per class of share, or have agreements with other shareholders relating to management and administration of any such companies, or its controlling entity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.267PX">
	The following table reflects the current members of our Board of Directors, their respective positions on the Board of Directors and the year they were appointed to such position.
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Additional information regarding the occupation and employment background of each of our regular directors is set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Ricardo I. Monge
</I>
	has served as adviser to the Executive Director of Petrobras Argentina since 2008. He graduated with a degree in Industrial Engineering from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	and obtained a Post-graduate degree in Management Development Program and a Post-graduate degree in Corporate Finance at UADE. Since March 2002, he has held different managerial positions at Petrobras Argentina. Previously he worked as Business Manager for Eg3 S.A. and Isaura S.A. He is currently a member of the Board of Directors of MEGA, CIESA and Petrobras Hispano Argentina S.A. He was born on May 16, 1951.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Gustavo Mariani
</I>
	has a Master in Finance from the CEMA University, a degree in Economics from the University of Belgrano, and is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) since 1998. He is a partner and managing director of Grupo Dolphin S.A. In 2005, he became Director in Pampa where he currently serves as Chairman. He also serves as Director on the Boards of Edenor S.A., Transba S.A., CIESA, Central T&#233;rmica G&#252;emes S.A., Central T&#233;rmica Loma La Lata S.A., and Central T&#233;rmica Piedra Buena S.A. and he is Chairman of Hidroel&#233;ctrica Los Nihuiles S.A. and Hidroel&#233;ctrica Diamante S.A. Prior to 2005 Mr. Mariani served as Chief Financial Officer (
<B>
	&#147;CFO&#148;
</B>
	) of Grupo IRSA/Cresud/Alto Palermo. He was born on September 9, 1970.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	H&#233;ctor Daniel Casal
</I>
	graduated in Law from the
<I>
	Universidad Cat&#243;lica Argentina
</I>
	in 1980. He joined Petrobras Argentina in 1991. Since 2003, he has acted as Legal Vice President at Petrobras Argentina. Currently, he serves as Director of CIESA, and Petrobras Electricidad de Argentina and as alternate Director of Petrobras Argentina, Edesur S.A. and Petrolera Entre Lomas. He also serves as Director abroad in Petrobras Argentina Colombia, Petrobras Holding Austria GmbH and Petrobras Financial Services Austria GmbH. He was born on April 10, 1956.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Sonia Fabiana Salvatierra
</I>
	received a degree in Law from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	. Between 1987 and 1996 she worked for the Caja de Valores S.A. Between 1996 and 2008 she acted as associate for Marval O&#146;Farrell &amp; Mairal. Currently, she is partner in the Salvatierra &amp; Asociados law firm. She is also a member of the board of directors of CIESA. She was born on March 20, 1966.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Javier Bernardo Sato
</I>
	received a Chemical Engineering degree from the Universidad de Buenos Aires. He worked for Petrobras Argentina in several positions. From October 2013 until now, he has acted as the Marketing Manager at the Downstream division of the company. In April 2008, he joined TGS and worked as Planning and Business Development Vice President until June 2010, when he was appointed as Business Vice President until October 2013. Between October 2005 and March 2008, he acted as CEO of Conecta (a gas distribution company in Uruguay). Until March 2005, he served as Planning and Business Development Manager of the refining, petrochemical and fertilizing business unit of Petrobras Argentina and between April 2004 and September 2005; he worked for Petrobras in Brazil. &nbsp;He also acts as a member of the board of directors of Telcosur, Compa&#241;&#237;a Mega, CIESA and TGS. He was born on June 28, 1956.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Diego Alberto G&#252;erri
</I>
	received a Law degree from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	. He also obtained a Master&#146;s Degree in Business Administration from IAE Business School,
<I>
	Universidad Austral
</I>
	. Between October 2002 and 2005, he acted as liquidator of Quilseg S.A., Quilburs S.A., Capi S.A., Cirqui S.A., Dispel S.A. and Faique S.A. He was partner of the Zarantonello &amp; G&#252;erri law firm between 1999 and 2007. Since 2007, he has been a partner of the law firm G&#252;erri. He was born on January 8, 1969.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Carlos Olivieri
</I>
	holds a Public Accountant degree from the
<I>
	Universidad Nacional de Rosario
</I>
	and a postgraduate degree in Corporate Financial Management from the University of Michigan (USA) and Stanford. At present, Mr. Olivieri is professor of Finance of Di Tella&nbsp;University. Between 2008 and March 2010, Mr. Olivieri acted as a financial advisor at Raymond James and between 2002 and 2007 he worked for Repsol YPF S.A. as CFO for Argentina, Brazil and Bolivia. Previously he acted as CFO of YPF S.A., Quilmes Industrial S.A. and Eaton S.A. and president of YPF GAS S.A. and Maxus Corporation (USA). He also had executive responsibilities in other industries, such as Aerol&#237;neas Argentinas and Arthur Andersen &amp; Co. and taught at the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	and Michigan Universities. Currently, Mr. Olivieri is also member of the board of directors of Provida AFP (Chile) and International Advice.
<I>
</I>
	He was born on May 14, 1950.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	50
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:579.867PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Mauricio Edgardo Szmulewiez
</I>
	received a Law and Accounting degrees, both from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires.
</I>
	Between April 1982 and October 1989, he worked for Lisdero Law Firm as tax and foreign investments manager. Since 1989, he is the owner of Dr. Mauricio Edgardo Szmulewiez law and accounting firm. He was born on January 19, 1960.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Sergio Benito Patr&#243;n Costas
</I>
	received a law degree from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires.
</I>
	From 1994 to 2002, he occupied several positions in the Federal Criminal and Correctional Court of Autonomous City of Buenos Aires. Between 2002 and 2006, he acted as lawyer in Urtubey &amp; Asociados Law firm and Group M Collection.
<I>
</I>
	At present, he is Head of Labor Relations in Macro Bank. He was born on December 31, 1975.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	There is no expiration term defined for the executive officers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Below is a description of the main activities currently carried out by each of our executive officers, together with the biographical information thereof:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Javier Gremes Cordero
</I>
	received a Public Accounting degree from the
<I>
	Universidad Cat&#243;lica Argentina
</I>
	, a Master&#146;s in Science from the Universit&#233; de Management, Switzerland and a MBA from the Universidad Francisco de Vitoria, Spain. He worked for Perez Companc from January 1993 to September 2002. Between October 2002 and February 2006, he worked for Petrobras Argentina in the Financial Department of the E&amp;P business unit. Between March 2006 and February 2009, he served as CFO and from March 2009 to November 2012 as CEO of Petrobras Ecuador. He became our CEO in November 2012. He was born on January 11, 1962.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Gonzalo Castro Olivera
</I>
	received a degree in Business Administration from the
<I>
	Universidad de Belgrano
</I>
	and a Master&#146;s Degree in Finance from the
<I>
	Universidad Torcuato Di Tella
</I>
	. Between 1997 and 1998, he worked for the ABN AMRO Bank N.V. and, between 1991 and 1997, he worked at BankBoston. In both banks, he worked in corporate banking. He joined us as Head of Capital Markets in 1998, and from 2005 to 2007, he was our Finance and Corporate Information Manager. He became our CFO in 2007. He was born on October 23, 1968.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Benjam&#237;n Guzm&#225;n
</I>
	received
<B>
</B>
	an Electromechanical Engineering degree and a Bachelor in Chemistry Degree from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	. He obtained a Master in Business Administration from
<I>
	IDEA
</I>
	and a Master in Regulations of Gas and Electricity Industries from
<I>
	CEARE
</I>
	. Between January 1997 and October 2010 he held different managerial positions in Petrobras Argentina. He has served as our Operations Vice President since November 2010. He was born on September 25, 1956. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Rub&#233;n De Muria
</I>
	received a Public Accountant degree from the Universidad de Buenos Aires. He obtained a Master in Regulations of Gas and Electricity Industries from
<I>
	CEARE
</I>
	. He worked for Chase Manhattan Bank Argentina and Perez Companc SA between 1985 and December 1992. In December 1992, he joined us as member of the Regulatory Matters and Rates Department. In August 2006 he was promoted to Regulatory Matters and Rates Manager. Finally, in December 2015 he was appointed as Institutional and Regulatory Affairs Executive Manager. He was born on January 31, 1964.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:53.267PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Nicol&#225;s M. Mordeglia
</I>
	received a Law degree from the Universidad de Buenos Aires in 1988 and a Master&#146;s degree in Business Law and an Executive Business Program from Universidad Austral in 1994. During 2002 he attended an Executive Management Business Program at IAE. He worked for the Legal Affairs Department of SADE Ingenier&#237;a y Construcciones S.A. (f/k/a Sade S.A.C.C.I.F.I.M.) from 1990 to 1992, and for the Legal Affairs Department of Compa&#241;ia Naviera Perez Companc S.A.C.F.I.M.F.A. from 1993 to 1995. He worked for the Legal Affairs Department of Cerro Vanguardia S.A. (f/k/a Minera Mincorp S.A.) from 1995 to 1999. From 1999 to 2010, he worked for the Legal Affairs Department of Petrobras Argentina S.A. (f/k/a Pecom Energia S.A.) and has been appointed to several boards of directors and Statutory Committees in corporations in Argentina and abroad where Petrobras Argentina has interests including TGS and CIESA. Since August 2010, he has served as our Legal Affairs Vice President. He was born on August 17, 1965.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Carlos H. Sidero
</I>
	graduated from the National University of Buenos Aires as a Certified Public Accountant in Argentina. He worked with Isaura S.A. from 1981 through 1994. From 1994 he managed different areas within the Human Resources department at Eg3 SA and Petrobras Argentina S.A. He joined TGS in March 2013 as Vice President Human Resources. He was born on February 16, 1956.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Alejandro Basso
</I>
	received a Public Accounting degree from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires
</I>
	. He worked for Petrobras Argentina from 1987 to 1992 and for Quitral-Co S.A. from 1992 to 1994. From 1994 to 1998 he acted as our Planning and Corporate Control Manager and between September 1998 and March 2008 he was our Planning and Control Vice President. Since March 2008, he has been our Management Control and Corporate Governance Vice President. He also acts as alternate director of TGU, EGS and Telcosur. He was born on October 13, 1961.
</P>
<A NAME="TGS_HTM_OLE_LINK25">
</A>
<A NAME="TGS_HTM_OLE_LINK28">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	Oscar Sardi
</I>
	received a Mechanical Engineering degree from the
<I>
	Universidad Nacional de Rosario
</I>
	and holds a major in Natural Gas from the
<I>
	Universidad de Buenos Aires.
</I>
	He also participated in a General Administration Program at the
<I>
	Universidad Austral
</I>
	. He worked for GdE between 1983 and 1992 and from that year he has held different positions in our operations area. In April 2005, he was designated Service Vice President of TGS. He also acts as alternate director of Link and Telcosur. He was born on September 1, 1955.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<I>
	N&#233;stor Hugo Mart&#237;n
</I>
	obtained a degree in Chemical Engineering from the
<I>
	Universidad Nacional del Sur,
</I>
	Bah&#237;a Blanca. Mr. Mart&#237;n has wide experience in the oil and gas industry. Between 1976 and 2002 he held different positions in companies such as ESSO S.A.P.A., YPF, Isaura S.A. and EG3. In 2002 he joined Petrobras Argentina where he served in many managerial positions especially related to planning, business, supply and trading. In 2013, he was designated as our Business Vice President. He was born on April 17, 1953.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	For additional information regarding the provisions include in the Shareholders&#146; Agreement for the election of our CEO, see &#147;Item 7. Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#151;A. Major Shareholders&#151;Shareholders&#146; Agreement.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<B>
<I>
	Indemnification of Officers and Directors
</I>
	.
</B>
	Under the Shareholders&#146; Agreement, the shareholders of CIESA require us to: (i) limit the liability of each of our officers, syndics and directors for all consequences of their acts or omissions, excluding acts or omissions where there is evidence of fraud or gross negligence and (ii)&nbsp;enter into agreements obligating us to defend, indemnify and hold harmless each of our officers, syndics and directors from and against all liabilities, losses, and other expenses incurred by each such officer, syndic or director in connection with a pending, threatened or completed civil, criminal, administrative or other proceeding, or any investigation that could lead to such a proceeding, by reason of the fact that such officer, syndic or director is or was one of our officers, syndics or directors, including claims alleged to be due to the negligence of such person, but excluding acts or omissions that involve fraud or gross negligence towards us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:168PX; WIDTH:192PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:192PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	Compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The remuneration paid by us during the year 2015 in favor of our members of the Board of Directors and executive officers amounted to Ps. 4.2 million
<B>
</B>
	and Ps. 21.9 million, respectively. We do not grant pension or retirement plans or other benefits to members of our Board of Directors or to our executive officers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Executive officers are subject to a goal-directed management system with a variable remuneration program. Consensual objectives are in line with our global objectives, as the variable remuneration program links a portion of its compensation to the performance thereof and our performance. Total compensation of executive officers consists of a fixed portion (normal and usual remuneration) and a variable portion. The variable portion depends on the level of achievement of the &#147;Outcome&#148; objectives, which consist of economic and financial targets, and &#147;Performance Results,&#148; including business objectives that do not have an associated economic result. We measure achievement of these objectives annually, based on performance during the fiscal period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:168PX; WIDTH:192PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:192PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	Board Practices
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.2PX; FONT-FAMILY:SERIF,TIMES NEW ROMAN; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	For information on the term of office of our directors and executive officers, see
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;A. Directors and Senior Management&#148; above.
</FONT>
	The information in that section is incorporated herein by reference
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:47.2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	None of the members of our Board of Directors are party to any service contract with us or any of our subsidiaries providing for benefits upon termination of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to the Capital Market Law, publicly listed companies must have an Audit Committee &#147;that will function on a collegiate basis with three or more members of the Board of Directors, the majority of whom must be independent under CNV regulations.&#148; The Audit Committee operates under its Rules of Procedure, which was approved in its meeting held in 2013 in accordance with the requirements of the Capital Market Law. The Rules of Procedure require that the majority of the members that form the Audit Committee must be independent according to the CNV&#146;s standards. Committee members are designated by a simple majority of the Board of Directors, at the first meeting following designation of the members of the Board of Directors, and they hold office until their successors are designated. The Audit Committee adopts its own regulations and must prepare a working plan for each fiscal year. At the General Annual Shareholders&#180; Meeting held on April 20, 2016, Diego Alberto G&#252;erri, Carlos Alberto Olivieri and Mauricio Mauricio Edgardo Szmulewiez were designated as independent members of the Board of Directors and Alejandro Candioti, Diego Petrecolla and Sergio Benito Patr&#243;n Costas were appointed as their alternates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	The Board of Directors meeting held on April 20, 2016 appointed the current members of the Audit Committee, who as of the date of this filing are
</FONT>
	Diego Alberto G&#252;erri, Carlos Alberto Olivieri and Mauricio Edgardo Szmulewiez. All of the current members of our Audit Committee are independent under CNV and SEC regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:48.933PX; TEXT-INDENT:-12.467PX">
	The Audit Committee&#146;s mandatory periodic duties are to:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	supervise the internal control and accounting systems as well as the reliability of the latter and all the financial information and other significant issues that are to be submitted to the SEC, CNV and BASE in compliance with the applicable disclosure policies;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	supervise the application of information policies regarding our risk management;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	ensure that the market is informed about those operations where there may be a conflict of interest with one or more members of the Board of Directors, controlling shareholders or other parties as defined by the applicable regulations;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	express its view on the reasonableness of fees and stock option plans for directors submitted by the Board of Directors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	express its view as to compliance with laws and regulations and the reasonableness of the conditions of an issuance of shares (or convertible securities), in the case of a capital increase excluding or limiting preferential rights;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	verify compliance with the Code of Ethics (see Item 16.B. Code of Ethics);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	issue a well-founded opinion on whether the terms and conditions of relevant transactions with related parties are according to market practice, within five calendar days from the receipt of a petition issued by the Board of Directors, and at any other time at which a conflict of interest exists or might exist;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	prepare an annual working plan for the fiscal year and notify the Board of Directors and the Statutory Committee within 60 days from the beginning of the period;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	fulfill all the obligations stated in our By-laws and applicable laws and regulations;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	express its view on the Board of Directors&#146; proposals appointing (or rejecting) the external auditors to be hired and monitor the auditors&#146; independence; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	establish procedures for: (i) the receipt, treatment, investigation and administration of the complaints received by us regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or internal auditing matters; and (ii) the confidential, anonymous submission by our employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or internal auditing matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-12PX">
	Also, regarding the internal and external auditors, the Audit Committee must:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	review their plans; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	evaluate their performance, and give an opinion on their performance when issuing the annual Financial Statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:36PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In evaluating the external auditors&#146; performance, the Audit Committee must:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	analyze the different services rendered by the external auditors as well as their independence, according to Technical Resolution (&#147;
<B>
	TR
</B>
	&#148;) No. 34 of the FACPCE, any other related regulations issued by professional councils and those regulations set by Title II, Chapter III, Article 21 of the Rules of the CNV;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	report separately the fees billed as follows: (i) fees for external audit and other related services meant to provide reliability to third parties (e.g., special reports about internal controls, shareholding prospectuses, certifications and special reports requested by regulators, etc.); and (ii) fees related to other special services different from those mentioned above, such as those associated with design and implementation of systems, laws and regulations, financial issues, etc.; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	verify the independence of the external auditors in accordance with internal policies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Additionally, the Audit Committee must perform the following mandatory duties contained in the regulatory framework:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	give a prior assessment, within five days of notification, that shall be used by the CNV to require us to designate an external auditor as requested by minority shareholders, as long as such shareholders represent at least 5% of our common stock (in those cases in which the minority shareholders&#146; rights might be affected), in order to carry out one or more specific revisions. The charges of such revisions shall be paid by the petitioning shareholders (Law No. 26,381, article 108.e);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	provide a well-founded assessment about an acquiring tender offer if by withdrawing the public offering we would cease to be a public company or our stock cease to be traded (Law No. 26,381, article 98); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:60PX; WIDTH:84PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:84PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	issue a report supporting a Board of Directors&#146; resolution to buy back our shares (Law No. 26,381, article 64).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Once a year, the Audit Committee is required to prepare a plan for the fiscal year to be presented to the Board of Directors and to the Statutory Committee. The directors, members of the Statutory Committee, managers and external auditors must, when requested by the Audit Committee, attend its meetings, provide the Audit Committee with information and otherwise assist the Audit Committee in the performance of its functions. In order to better perform its functions, the Audit Committee may seek the advice of legal counsel and other independent professionals at our expense, pursuant to a budget approved by the shareholders, and we must provide the Audit Committee with access to the information and documents it may deem necessary to perform its duties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to CNV rules, at least once a year and upon the filing of the annual Financial Statements, the Audit Committee shall issue a report to the shareholders, addressing how the Committee performed its duties and the results of its work.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The aggregate remuneration paid by us during the year 2015 to the members of the Audit Committee was approximately Ps. 1.4 million. We do not provide pension, retirement or similar benefits to any member of the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Statutory Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The Statutory Committee is our monitoring body as stipulated in Section No. 284 of the General Corporations Law. Our By-laws provide for a Statutory Committee consisting of three syndics and three alternate members (
<B>
	&#147;alternate syndics&#148;
</B>
	). In accordance with our By-laws, two syndics and the corresponding alternate syndics are elected by a majority vote of the holders of our Class A Shares. The remaining syndic and corresponding alternate syndic are elected by the majority vote of the remaining holders of our common stock. Each member of the Statutory Committee is elected at the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting and serves for a one-year renewable term. Members of the Statutory Committee must be lawyers or accountants qualified under Argentine law and, for the accountants, TR No. 15. Our directors, officers and employees may not be members of the Statutory Committee, all members must be independent. Our By-laws require the Statutory Committee to hold meetings at least once per month.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The primary responsibilities of the Statutory Committee consist of monitoring our management&#146;s compliance with the General Corporations Law, our By-laws and the shareholders&#146; resolutions, and without prejudice to the role of external auditors, reporting to the shareholders at the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting regarding the reasonableness of our financial information. Furthermore, the members of the Statutory Committee are entitled to: (i) attend Board of Directors and shareholders&#146; meetings, (ii) call Extraordinary Shareholders&#146; Meetings when deemed necessary and General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meetings when the Board of Directors fails to do so, and (iii) investigate written inquires initiated by the shareholders. The Statutory Committee does not control our operations or evaluate management&#146;s decisions, which are the exclusive responsibility of the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The aggregate remuneration paid by us during 2015 to the members of the Statutory Committee was approximately Ps. 1.1 million. We do not provide pension, retirement or similar benefits for syndics and alternate syndics.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	The following table sets out the current membership of our Statutory Committee, each of whom was appointed at the General Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting held on April 20, 2016, the year when each member was initially appointed and the year when their term expires:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>
