<A NAME="FIS_CORPORATE_GOVERNANCE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:16PX; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
<B>
	Item 16G. Corporate Governance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our corporate governance practices are governed by:
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	applicable Argentine law (particularly, the General Corporations Law),
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capital Market Law and Decree No. 1,023/2013, &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	the standards of the CNV,
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	our By-laws,
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	our Code of Conduct and other internal control policies and procedures, and
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:72PX; WIDTH:96PX; FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#167;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	certain rules of the NYSE applicable to listed foreign private issuers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	We have securities that are registered with the SEC and listed on the NYSE and, consequently, we are subject to the rules and regulations of the NYSE.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Under the Corporate Governance Standards issued by the NYSE in Section 303A of its Listed Company Manual (the
<B>
	&#147;NYSE Standards&#148;
</B>
	), non-U.S. companies are permitted, in general, to follow their home country corporate governance practices in lieu of the provisions included in such Section. However, non-U.S. companies must comply with sections 303A.06, 303A.11 and 303A.12(b) and (c).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Our Corporate Governance Guidelines are available on our website www.tgs.com.ar.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to Section 303A.11 of the NYSE Standards, foreign private issuers must disclose any significant ways in which their corporate governance practices differ from those followed by U.S. issuers. Accordingly, the following list reflects such differences:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to NYSE Standards, listed companies must have a majority of independent directors. Argentine law does not require a majority of independent directors, but does require at least two independent directors on the Audit Committee. At our Board of Directors meeting held on April 20, 2016, three independent directors (meeting the independence criteria set forth in the NYSE Standards) were appointed to the Audit Committee. We also have three alternate directors who qualify as independent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Meeting of Non-Management Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to NYSE requirements, the non-management directors must meet at regularly scheduled executive sessions without management. None of Argentine law, the CNV rules or our By-laws requires that any such meetings be held. Under Argentine law, a board of directors must meet at least once every three months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	U.S. listed companies must have a nominating/corporate governance committee composed entirely of independent directors. Argentine law and regulations do not require us to have a nominating or corporate governance committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Compensation Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	U.S. listed companies must have a compensation committee composed entirely of independent directors. Argentine law and regulations do not require this committee. However, our Audit Committee is required to give an opinion about the reasonableness of directors&#146; fees and executive officers&#146; compensation and stock option plans (if applicable), as proposed by our Board of Directors, and the fee paid to members of our Board of Directors is approved by our shareholders at their ordinary annual meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to SEC regulations, listed companies must have an audit committee consisting of a minimum of three independent members. The members of the Audit Committee must be financially literate or must acquire such financial knowledge within a reasonable period and at least one of its members shall have expertise in accounting or financial management. Also, if a member of the Audit Committee is simultaneously a member of the Audit Committee of more than three public companies, and the listed company does not limit the number of Audit Committees on which its members may serve, then, in each case the Board of Directors shall determine whether the simultaneous service would prevent such members from effectively serving on the listed company&#146;s Audit Committee, and shall disclose its decision in the annual proxy statement of the company or in the company&#146;s annual report filed with the SEC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Argentine law requires an Audit Committee to be comprised of at least three members with a majority of independent members. Pursuant to CNV standards, Audit Committee members are required to have knowledge in business, financial or accounting matters and issues. In addition, CNV standards require the training of Audit Committee members in the practice areas that would permit them to carry out their duties on the Audit Committee. Our Audit Committee is made of three independent members. One of them qualifies as a &#147;financial expert&#148; within the meaning of Item 16A of the Form 20-F. See &#147;Item 16A. Audit Committee Financial Expert.&#148; The Audit Committee&#146;s functions and duties are similar to those required by the NYSE. Furthermore, Argentine law does not limit the number of audit committees on which a member of its Audit Committee may serve.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	Code Conduct
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	According to Section 303A.10 of the NYSE Standards, listed companies must adopt and disclose a code of business conduct and ethics for directors, officers and employees, and promptly disclose any waivers of the code for directors or executive officers. In October 2005, our Board of Directors approved a &#147;Code of Conduct&#148; with the purpose of introducing SEC rules applicable to foreign registrants. Such code applies to all Board of Directors&#146; members, Audit Committee members, senior management, and employees, with no exceptions. Our Code of Conduct is available to the public on our website and as an Exhibit to this Annual Report.
</P>
</EFX_CORPORATE_GOVERNANCE>
</EFX_PART_II>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<B>
	CEO&#146;s Certification
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Each listed company CEO must annually certify to the NYSE that he or she is not aware of any violation by the company of the NYSE&#146;s corporate governance listing standards. There is no such requirement under Argentine law.
</P>
</EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<EFX_PART_II>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_II_2"></A>
<EFX_MINE_SAFETY_DISCLOSURE>
<A NAME="FIS_MINE_SAFETY_DISCLOSURE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:16PX; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
<B>
	Item 16H. Mine Safety Disclosure
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Not applicable.
</P>
</EFX_MINE_SAFETY_DISCLOSURE>
</EFX_PART_II>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Indenture dated as of May 14, 2007, among TGS, Law Debenture Trust Company of New York, as trustee, co-registrar, principal paying agent and transfer agent, and Banco Santander R&#237;o S.A., as registrar, paying agent and transfer agent, in respect of TGS&#146;s 7.875% Notes Due 2017.

	(3)
</SUP>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>

<SUP>
	(2)

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:96PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	2.3
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We hereby agree to furnish to the SEC, upon its request, copies of any instruments defining the rights of holders of our long-term debt (or any long-term debt of our subsidiaries for which we are required to filed consolidated or unconsolidated financial statements), where such indebtedness does not exceed 10% of our total consolidated assets.
</P>

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<U>
	CERTIFICATION
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	I, Javier Gremes Cordero, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A.;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The company&#146;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)), for the company and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:12PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	d)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The company&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent function):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: May 2, 2016
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	EXHIBIT 12.2
</B>

</EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<U>
	CERTIFICATION
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	I, Gonzalo Castro Olivera, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A.;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The company&#146;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)), for the company and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:12PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:60PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	d)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:60PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:24PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The company&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent function):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:48PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	d)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-6.6PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: May 2, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of
<BR>
	Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In our opinion, the accompanying consolidated statements of financial position and the related consolidated statements of comprehensive income, of changes in equity and of cash flow present fairly, in all material respects, &nbsp;the financial position of Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A. and its subsidiary
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#FF0000">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
	(&#147;the Company&#148;) at
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#FF0000">
</FONT>
	December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2015 in conformity with International Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Also in our opinion, the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2015, based on criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). The Company's management is responsible for these financial statements, for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting appearing under Item 15 to the Form 20-F. Our responsibility is to express opinions on these financial statements and on the Company's internal control over financial reporting based on our integrated audits. We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement and whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audits of the financial statements included examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. Our audits of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk. Our audits also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	the
</FONT>
	circumstances. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinions
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. &nbsp;A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (i)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (ii)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (iii)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. &nbsp;Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING:0PX; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX" VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=209.2 COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:-20.8PX; FONT-FAMILY:GEORGIA,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Carlos N. Mart&#237;nez
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:104PX; PADDING-RIGHT:113.4PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	_____________________________________________________________________________________________________
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:18.933PX; WIDTH:47.267PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:47.267PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<U>
	BUSINESS DESCRIPTION
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A. (&#147;TGS&#148;) is one of the companies created as a result of the privatization of Gas del Estado S.E. (&#147;GdE&#148;). TGS commenced operations on December 29, 1992 and it is engaged in the Transportation of Natural Gas and Production and Commercialization of natural gas Liquids (&#147;Liquids&#148;). TGS&#146;s pipeline system connects major gas fields in southern and western Argentina with gas distributors and industries in those areas and in the greater Buenos Aires area. The natural gas transportation license to operate this system was exclusively granted to TGS for a period of thirty-five years (&#147;the License&#148;). TGS is entitled to a one-time extension of ten years provided that it has essentially met the obligations imposed by the License and by the
<I>
	Ente Nacional Regulador del Gas
</I>
	(National Gas Regulatory Body or &#147;ENARGAS&#148;). The General Cerri Gas Processing Complex (the &#147;Cerri Complex&#148;), where TGS processes natural gas by extracting liquids, was transferred from GdE along with the gas transmission assets. TGS also provides midstream services, which mainly consist of gas treatment, removal of impurities from the natural gas stream, gas compression, wellhead gas gathering and pipeline construction, operation and maintenance services. Also, telecommunications services are provided through the subsidiary Telcosur S.A. These services consist of data transmission services through a network of terrestrial and digital radio relay.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="TGS_HTM_OLE_LINK47">
</A>
<A NAME="TGS_HTM_OLE_LINK48">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	TGS&#146;s controlling shareholder is Compa&#241;&#237;a de Inversiones de Energ&#237;a S.A. (&#147;CIESA&#148;), which holds 51% of the common stock. Local and foreign investors hold the remaining ownership of TGS&#146;s common stock. CIESA is under co-control of: (i) Petrobras Argentina S.A. (&#147;Petrobras Argentina&#148;) and a subsidiary (jointly &#147;Petrobras Argentina Group&#148;), which altogether hold 50% of CIESA&#146;s common stock and (ii) CIESA Trust (whose trustee is The Royal Bank of Scotland N.V. Sucursal Argentina) (&#147;the Trust&#148;) who has a trust shareholding of 40%. The remaining 10% is held by PEPCA S.A. (formerly known as EPCA S.A.) &#150; belonging to Pampa Energ&#237;a S.A. (&#147;Pampa Energ&#237;a&#148;) &#150; which exercises significant influence in CIESA. On December 29, 2015, the Royal Bank of Scotland N.V. Argentina Branch informed CIESA, Petrobras Argentina, PEPCA and TGS the deregistration in the authorization to operate as a commercial bank in Argentina as it was its request to the Central Bank of Argentina and thus, would shortly report to consideration its resignation as trustee. Therefore, TGS is evaluating its replacement and steps to follow.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The current ownership of CIESA&#146;s common stock is the result of the first stage of the Master Settlement and Mutual Release Agreement, signed on April 16, 2004 by Petrobras Argentina Group and subsidiaries of Enron Corp. (&#147;Enron&#148;) as of such date. The shareholding exchange was carried out on August 29, 2005, after ENARGAS approval by Note No. 4,858 issued in July 2005. At that time, Enron subsidiaries transferred 40% of the outstanding share capital of CIESA to the Trust; and Petrobras Argentina Group transferred its TGS class &#147;B&#148; common shares (representing 7.35% of the outstanding share capital of TGS) to Enron subsidiaries. Later, and within the framework of a settlement agreement entered into among CIESA, Petrobras Argentina Group, Inversiones Argentina I, Pampa Inversiones S.A. (both related companies of Pampa Energ&#237;a) and Pampa Energ&#237;a, owner of the total amount of the financial indebtedness of CIESA as of July 13, 2012, CIESA transferred 34,133,200 TGS Class B common shares &#150;representing 4.2962% in TGS- to Pampa Energ&#237;a. It was agreed that upon obtaining the governmental approval, Pampa Group will receive shares representing 40% of CIESA&#146;s capital stock which are held in the Trust. As of the date of issuance of these Financial Statements, ENARGAS has expressed no objections to the transfer of share, remaining pending the approval by the
<I>
	Comisi&#243;n Nacional de Defensa de la Competencia
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:18.933PX; WIDTH:46.933PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:46.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<U>
	CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	TGS presents its consolidated financial statements for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 in compliance with the provisions of Title IV, Chapter I, Section I, Article b.1) of the Rules of the
<I>
	Comisi&#243;n Nacional de Valores
</I>
	(&quot;CNV&quot;) (&quot;New Text 2013&quot; or &quot;NT 2013&quot;) adopted by General Resolution No. 622/13. In these consolidated financial statements as of December 31, 2015, TGS and Telcosur S.A., its consolidated subsidiary, are jointly referred to as &#147;the Company&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-6
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:104PX; PADDING-RIGHT:113.4PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	_____________________________________________________________________________________________________
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:18.933PX; WIDTH:46.933PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:46.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<U>
	BASIS OF PRESENTATION
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (&#147;IASB&#148;) and the International Financial Interpretations Committee (&#147;IFRIC&#148;), jointly the &#147;IFRS&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	NT 2013 mandates the application of Technical Resolution (&#147;TR&#148;) N&#176; 26 and TR N&#176; 29 approved by the
<I>
	Federaci&#243;n Argentina de Consejos Profesionales de Ciencias Econ&#243;micas
</I>
	(&#147;FACPCE&#148;). Both TRs establish that certain Argentine companies which are subject to the Argentine Public Offering Regime (Law No. 26,831) should adopt IFRS issued by the IASB.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The preparation of the consolidated financial statements in conformity with IFRS requires management to make accounting estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements, as well as the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting fiscal year. Estimates are used when accounting for the allowance for doubtful accounts, income taxes, provisions for legal claims and others, impairment of property, plant and equipment, and present value of long term receivables. Actual results could be significantly different from such estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:22.8PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The presentation in the statement of financial position distinguishes between current and non-current assets and liabilities. The assets and liabilities are those expected to be recovered or settled within twelve months after the end of the reporting period under review, and those held for sale. The fiscal year begins on January 1 and ends on December 31 of each year. The economic and financial results are presented on a fiscal year basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The consolidated financial statements are stated in thousands of Argentine pesos (&#147;Ps.&#148; or &#147;pesos&#148;), the functional currency of the Company and its subsidiary, unless otherwise stated. For further information, see Note 4.c.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:18.933PX; WIDTH:46.933PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:46.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<U>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:46.933PX; WIDTH:70.933PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	a)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:70.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	New accounting standards
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	New standards and interpretations issued by the IASB effective for the periods beginning on or after January 1, 2015 adopted by the Company
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Below is a description of the standards, amendments and interpretations to existing standards that have been issued and were mandatory for the Company&#146;s fiscal periods beginning on or after January 1, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Annual improvements to IFRSs 2010 &#150; 2012 Cycle
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The annual improvement to IFRSs 2010 &#150; 2012 Cycle include six amendments to IFRSs issued by the IASB, among them: IFRS 8 &#147;Segment Reporting&#148;. This amendment provides that the Company must make explicit the judgments made by the Management when applying the aggregation criteria in the operating segments. This amendment had no impact on the financial statements of TGS whenever no operating segments are grouped.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In addition, amendments to IFRS 2, IFRS 3, IFRS 13, IAS 16, IAS 24 and IAS 38 were introduced. In all cases, these amendments clarify existing requirements which have no impact on the financial statements of TGS.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-7
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:104PX; PADDING-RIGHT:113.4PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	_____________________________________________________________________________________________________
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Annual improvements to IFRSs 2011 &#150; 2013 Cycle
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The annual improvement to IFRSs 2011 &#150; 2013 Cycle include three amendments to IFRSs issued by the IASB, among them IFRS 13 &#147;Fair Value Measurement. In all cases, these amendments clarify existing requirements which have no impact on the financial statements of TGS.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The adoption of this standard has had no impact on the financial position or results of operations of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	New standards and interpretations issued by the IASB not effective for the periods beginning on January 1, 2015 and that have not been earlier adopted by the Company
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Below is a description of the standards, amendments and interpretations to existing standards that have been issued and are mandatory for the Company&#146;s fiscal periods beginning on or after January 1, 2015 or later and which have not been early adopted by the Company:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Amendments to IAS 1 &#147;Presentation of financial statements&#148;.
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In December 2014, the IASB issued amendments to IAS 1. The amendments aim is to clarify the guidance included in IAS 1 for the presentation of financial statements. Amendments to IAS 1 make the following changes:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:42.933PX; WIDTH:66.933PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:66.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Introduced modifications to the guidance included in IAS 1 regarding materiality considerations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:42.933PX; WIDTH:66.933PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:66.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The amendment added additional examples of possible ways of ordering the notes to clarify that understandability and comparability
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:42.933PX; WIDTH:66.933PX; FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	&#183;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:66.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Made clarification on the breakdown of information and the inclusion of subtotals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These amendments will be applicable for annual periods beginning on or after January 2016, with earlier application permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	IFRS 15 Revenue from contracts with customers
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In May 2014, IFRS 15 was issued which establishes a single model for entities to use in accounting for revenue arising from contracts with customers. IFRS 15 will supersede the current revenue recognition guidance including IAS 18 &#147;Revenue&#148;, IAS 11 &#147;Construction Contracts&#148; and the related interpretations when it becomes effective.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The core principle of IFRS 15 is that an entity shall assess the goods or services promised in a contract with a customer and shall identify as a performance obligation. IFRS 15 introduces a 5-step approach to revenue recognition:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Step 1: Identify the contract with a customer.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Step 2: Identify the performance obligations in the contract.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Step 3: Determine the transaction price.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Step 4: Allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Step 5: Recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies a performance obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The new revenue recognition model established in IFRS 15 is applicable to all contracts with customers, except lease contracts, insurance contracts and financial instruments. The recognition of interest and dividends are not under the scope of this standard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	IFRS 15 will be applicable for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018, with earlier application permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company is currently analyzing the impact of IFRS 15 requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-8
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:104PX; PADDING-RIGHT:113.4PX; FONT-SIZE:11PT; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	TRANSPORTADORA DE GAS DEL SUR S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements as of December 31, 2015 and comparative information
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	(Stated in thousands of pesos as described in Note 3, unless otherwise stated)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN=CENTER>
	_____________________________________________________________________________________________________
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	IFRS 9 Financial instruments
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In July 2014 a new revised version of IFRS 9 was issued. The complete version of IFRS 9 replaces the guidance in IAS 39 that relates to the classification and measurement of financial instruments. There is now a new expected credit losses model that replaces the incurred loss impairment model used in IAS 39. Also, new requirements to classify and measure financial assets were included in this version.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	IFRS 9 will be applicable for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018, with earlier application permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company is yet to assess IFRS 9&#146;s full impact.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Annual improvements to IFRSs 2012 &#150; 2014 Cycle
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The annual improvement to IFRSs 2012 &#150; 2014 Cycle include four amendments to IFRSs issued by the IASB, among them IAS 34 &#147;Interim financial reporting&#148;. The standard requires new disclosures to be included in the interim financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These amendments will be applicable for annual periods beginning on or after July 1, 2016, with earlier application permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company is currently analyzing the impact of the new disclosure requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	IFRS 16 &#147;Leases&#148;
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In January 2016, IFRS 16 was issued which establishes the new model of registration of leasing operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	This standard will replace the current guidance on the accounting for such operations in IAS 17 &quot;Leases&quot; and related interpretations when it comes into force.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	IFRS 16 will be effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2019, with earlier application permitted. Adoption is retroactive.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company is currently assessing the impact of IFRS 16 and at the date of these financial statements is not reasonably possible to determine its impact.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Amendments to IAS 12 &quot;Income Taxes&quot;
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In January 2016, the IASB issued certain amendments with respect to the recognition of deferred tax assets for unrealized losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These amendments will be effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2017, with early adoption permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Amendments to IAS 7 &quot;Statements of Cash Flows&quot;
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In February 2016, the IASB issued certain amendments regarding disclosures of the Statement of Cash Flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Modifications to the Disclosure Initiative (Amendments to IAS 7) aim entities to disclose information that enables users of financial statements to evaluate changes in liabilities arising from financing activities. For this purpose, the IASB requires that an entity shall disclose the following changes in liabilities arising from financing activities: (i) changes from financing cash flows; (ii) changes arising from obtaining or losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses; (iii) the effect of changes in foreign exchange rates; (iv) changes in fair value; and (v) other changes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Finally, the amendments state that changes in liabilities arising from financing activities must be disclosed separately from changes in other assets and liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These amendments will be effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2017, with early adoption permitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:46.933PX; WIDTH:70.933PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:70.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	Consolidation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	Subsidiary
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Subsidiaries are all entities (including structured entities) over which the Company has control. The Company controls an entity when the Company is exposed to, or has rights to, variable returns from its involvement with the entity and has the ability to affect those returns through its power over the entity. Subsidiaries are fully consolidated from the date on which control is transferred to the group. They are deconsolidated from the date that control ceases.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Inter-company transactions, balances and unrealized gains on transactions between group companies are eliminated. Unrealized losses are also eliminated. Accounting policies of subsidiaries have been changed where necessary to ensure consistency with the policies adopted by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Furthermore, Telcosur is the only consolidated subsidiary of the Company and its financial statements as of December 31, 2015 have been used for consolidation purposes. Detailed data reflecting subsidiary control as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=RIGHT>
<BR>
</P>
</DIV>

</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000" VALIGN=TOP WIDTH=132.267 COLSPAN=2>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:567PX">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	Associates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Associates are entities over which the group has significant influence but not control, generally accompanying a shareholding of between 20% and 50% of the voting rights. Investments in associates are accounted for using the equity method of accounting. Under the equity method, the investment is initially recognized at cost, and the carrying amount is increased or decreased to recognize the investor&#146;s share of the profit or loss of the investee after the date of acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	If the ownership interest in an associate is reduced but significant influence is retained, only a proportionate share of the amounts previously recognized in other comprehensive income is reclassified to profit or loss where appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company accounted for the investments in its associates, on the basis on the financial statements as of September 30, 2015 of Gas Link S.A. (&#147;Link&#148;), Transporte y Servicios de Gas en Uruguay SA (&#147;TGU&#148;) and Emprendimientos de Gas del Sur S.A. (&#147;EGS&#148;). The Company&#146;s management is not aware of any significant subsequent events which affected the financial statements as of September 30, 2015 of Link, TGU and EGS, from this date to December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Profits and losses resulting from upstream and downstream transactions between the Company and its associate are recognized in the Company&#146;s financial statements only to the extent of unrelated investor&#146;s interests in the associates. Unrealized losses are eliminated unless the transaction provides evidence of an impairment of the asset transferred. Accounting policies of associates have been changed where necessary to ensure consistency with the policies adopted by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	When the Company&#146;s share of losses in an associate equals or exceeds its interest in the associate, including any other unsecured receivables, the Company does not recognize further losses, unless it has incurred legal or constructive obligations or made payments on behalf of the associate. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	According with Link&#146;s accounting policies, certain items of PPE are measured using the revaluation model, meanwhile, as it is stated in note 4.j to the present Financial Statements, the Company use the cost model to measure PPE items. &nbsp;Furthermore, as of December 31, 2015, investment in &#147;Link&#148; has been reduced to zero in the extent that it recorded a shareholder&#146;s equity below zero according to the accounting policies used by TGS. As of the date of issuance of these financial statements, has not incurred in any legal or constructive obligation or made payments on behalf of the associate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Dilution gains and losses arising in investments in associates are recognized in the statements of comprehensive income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In the table below, associates are disclosed, together with the percentage of shareholding and voting as of December 31, 2015 and 2014:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
