</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	20. &nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company had the following contractual commitments:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/05/02/0000931427-16-000027_TGS143.GIF" ALT="[TGS143.GIF]" ALIGN=TOP HEIGHT=132.267 WIDTH=567>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Approximately the 99.7% of the financial indebtedness of TGS and the totality of the obligations corresponding to gas purchases are denominated in U.S. dollars which have been translated into Argentine pesos at the exchange rate as of December 31, 2015 (US$ 1.00 = Ps. 13.04). The amounts to be paid in pesos could vary depending on the actual fluctuations in the exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	21. &nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	SUBSIDIARY AND ASSOCIATES
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Link:
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Link was created in February 2001, with the purpose of the operation of a natural gas transportation system, which links TGS&#146;s natural gas transportation system with the Cruz del Sur S.A. pipeline. The connection pipeline extends from Buchanan, located in the high-pressure ring that surrounds the city of Buenos Aires, which is part of TGS&#146;s pipeline system, to Punta Lara. TGS&#146;s ownership interest in such company is 49% and Dinarel S.A. holds the remaining 51%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	TGU:
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	TGU is a company incorporated in Uruguay. This company rendered operation and maintenance services to Gasoducto Cruz del Sur S.A. and its contract terminated in 2010. TGS holds 49% of its common stock and Petrobras Argentina holds the remaining 51%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	EGS:
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In September 2003, EGS, a company registered in Argentina, was incorporated. The ownership is distributed between TGS (49%) and TGU (51%). EGS operates its own pipeline, which connects TGS&#146;s main pipeline system in the Province of Santa Cruz with a delivery point on the border with Chile.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In October 2012, ENARGAS issued a resolution which authorizes EGS to transfer the connection pipeline and service offerings in operation to TGS. On December 17, 2013 the sale of all the fixed assets of EGS to TGS for an amount of $ 350,000 was made, the existing natural gas transportation contracts were transferred and the procedures to dissolve the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	TGS Board of Directors&#146; meeting held on January 13, 2016, approved to initiate the necessary steps for the dissolution of EGS.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	22. &nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The financial statements were authorized for issuance by the Board of Directors on February 24, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	No subsequent events between the end of the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015 and the date of the issuance (authorization) of these consolidated financial statements have had a material effect on the financial position or the results of operations of the Company, except for the mentioned below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Dividend payment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board Meeting held on January 13, 2016 decided to pay a cash dividend by means of the total dissolution of the Reserve for future dividends for Ps. 99,734 according to the powers delegated by the Ordinary and Extraordinary Meeting of Shareholders held on April 23, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Legal claims
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-0.067PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
<U>
	Action for annulment of ENARGAS the Resolutions (Note 18 c.)
</U>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	On March 17, 2016, the Lower Court in administrative federal matters based in the City of Buenos Aires, extended the preliminary injunction for a new period of six months. Thus, the new injunction expires in September 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In addition, pursuant Resolution No. 28/2016 issued by the Ministry of Energy on March 28, 2016, it decided to derogate all the administrative actions taken to set the applicable amount to the natural gas import charge. Although, Resolution No. 28/2016 results applicable since April 1, 2016, the Company will continue with the constitutional challenge filed against the Resolutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	Regulatory framework
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	On February 24, 2016, jointly with the Ministry of Energy and the MHF we signed a new Transitional Agreement (&#147;2016 Transitional Agreement&#148;). It sets the guidelines to conclude with the Integral Tariff Review and to receive an additional transitional increase on our tariff applicable to the Natural Gas Transportation business segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	On March 31, 2016, the ENARGAS issued Resolution No. I-3724/2016 (&#147;Resolution No. 3724&#148;) which granted to TGS a 200.1% tariff increase effective as from April 1, 2016. It was conceded to attend to TGS&#146;s financial and operational needs as well to comply with a mandatory investment plan (the &#147;Investment Plan&#148;).
</FONT>
	The Investment Plan implies future capital expenditures of Ps. 794.3 million overseen by the ENARGAS to be executed by TGS until March 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	The transitional increase will be in force until the Integral Renegotiation Agreement will be signed, which according to the 2016 Transitional Agreement would be in the next 12 months after the issuance of the &nbsp;Resolution No. 3724.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In addition,
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	following
</FONT>
	Section 10 of Resolution No. 3724 and as per the 2016 Transitional Agreement, TGS shall not be allowed to pay dividends without the ENARGAS&#146; prior authorization, to which end evidence of compliance with the Investment Plan shall be submitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<U>
	Annual Ordinary Shareholders&#146; Meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	On April 20, 2016, the Annual Ordinary Shareholders&#146; Meeting approved the creation of a new voluntary reserve for Capital Expenditures Reserve of Ps. 2.9 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<U>
	Negotiation of the indirect participation in the Company
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	On March 2, 2016, Pampa Energ&#237;a disclosed their agreement with Petroleo Brasileiro S.A. (&#147;Petrobras&#148;) to a 30-day exclusivity period, which could be extended for another 30 days, to continue their negotiations for the acquisition of Petrobras&#146;s capital and voting stocks in Petrobras Argentina, the holder of the 50% voting rights on CIESA. On April 8, 2016, Pampa Energ&#237;a disclosed that negotiations with Petrobras for the sale of the controlling share in Petrobras Argentina would continue for another 30 days.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	In each of its press releases related to the potential sale of its controlling interest, Petrobras has stated that any such transaction&#146;s terms and conditions would be subject to approval by its executive board and its board of directors, as well as by the relevant regulatory entities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	In addition, on March 9, 2016, Pampa disclosed that, as part of its ongoing evaluation of its corporate strategy, and taking into consideration the negotiations to acquire Petrobras Argentina, its board of directors had approved the commencement of negotiations for the sale of its indirect stake in us. On April 22, 2016, Pampa disclosed that it had agreed to a 45-day exclusivity period with Harz Energy, a subsidiary of Grupo Neuss, in order to negotiate the sale of Pampa&#146;s ownership of, and any direct or indirect rights that it has in, TGS.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:18.933PX; PADDING-RIGHT:37.733PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	23. &nbsp;
<U>
	INFORMATION REQUIRED BY ARTICLE 26 OF SECTION VII CHAPTER IV TITLE II OF CNV RULES
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In order to comply with General Resolution No. 629/2014 of the CNV, TGS informs that by February 24, 2016, supporting and management documentation related to open tax periods is safeguarded by Iron Mountain Argentina S.A. at its facilities are located at 3825 Ca&#241;ada de G&#243;mez Street in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As for commercial books and accounting records, they are situated in the headquarters of the Company in areas that ensure its preservation and inalterability.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:3.4PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company has available in its headquarters to CNV details of the documentation given in safeguard to third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
